children.name: num_cols
children.label: How many people do you want to show?

children.name: custom_color
children.label: Custom Text Color:
children.help_text: This will override the default color schedule.

children.name: card_padding
children.label: Card Padding
children.help_text: This will control the spacing around all the content inside of the card.

children.name: card_text_padding
children.label: Card Text Padding:
children.help_text: This will control the spacing around just the quote, name, and title.

children.name: photo_full
children.label: Full Width Photo
children.help_text: With this option turned on, the photo will take up the full with of the column no matter what size it is.  If you'd like to control the size of the photo with the settings when adding a photo, keep this off.

children.name: circle
children.label: Make Photo a Circle:
children.help_text: In order to use this feature, the image you upload must be a perfect square or it will look a bit funky.  IMPORTANT: You'll need to make sure you have "photo full" turned off.

children.name: card_link
children.label: Link Card to Other Page:
children.help_text: This will allow you to turn the photo, person's name into links.

children.label: Select Star Rating:

children.name: test
children.label: Test:
children.inline_help_text: This is currently a test. Please disregard.

children.name: bg_image
children.label: Upload Your Background Image:
children.help_text: The recommended size is 1920 x 1280px

children.name: parallax
children.label: Parallax Scrolling:
children.help_text:
If you turn this on, be sure that you have uploaded a background image with a large enough height so that there is room for the image to do its scrolling magic. 

1920 x 1280px will work great in most cases but it depends on the height of this content row. 

IMPORTANT: If you are not using a background image, it's BEST to keep this off.

children.name: parallax_on_mobile
children.label: Parallax On Mobile
children.help_text: Enables Parallax On Mobile

children.name: bg_size
children.label: Background Size:
children.help_text:
Cover: Resize the background image to cover the entire container, even if it has to stretch the image or cut a little bit off one of the edges

Contain: Resize the background image to make sure the image is fully visible.

Initial: Sets this property to its default value.

children.name: img_pos
children.label: Image Position:
children.help_text:
This will allow you to select which portion of the image you'd like to show.  

Since this is a "background image" that needs to be responsive to a variety of screen sizes, there will ways be a portion of the photo cropped out.

children.name: shadow
children.label: Do you want to add a subtle shadow?
children.help_text: This will add a subtle inner or outer shadow on the entire row.

children.name: overlay_bg
children.label: Do you want to add an overlay?

children.name: add_wave_top
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Top):
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the top of this row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color
children.help_text: If the row above has a white background you'll want to set the color of the wave to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row above.

children.name: add_wave_btm
children.label: Add Wave/Angle Border (Bottom):
children.help_text: This is a cool page design element that can give your page a sense of flow and movement.
children.inline_help_text: Add wave border at the base of this row.

children.name: color
children.label: Color
children.help_text: If the row above has a white background you'll want to set the color of the wave to white.
children.inline_help_text: Set this to the same color as the row below.

children.name: pull_up
children.label: Pull content over the row above:
children.help_text: This will give you the option to pull the content container up over the row above. This can be an awesome visual technique when used subtly.

children.name: pull_up_num_desktop
children.label: Pull Up Content (Desktop):
children.help_text: This will allow you to set how much you want the content container to overlap the row above by.

children.name: pull_up_num_tablet
children.label: Pull Up Content (Tablet):
children.help_text: This will allow you to set how much you want the content container to overlap the row above by.

children.name: pull_up_num_mobile
children.label: Pull Up Content (Mobile):
children.help_text: This will allow you to set how much you want the content container to overlap the row above by on mobile devices.

children.name: con_padding
children.label: Container Padding:
children.help_text: It's a good idea to give the content a little breathing room. This is where you can set the padding.

children.name: subtle_shadow
children.label: Add Subtle Shadow:
children.help_text: This will add a slight glow around the content container to lift it of the page ever so elegantly.

children.name: section_id
children.label: CSS ID:
children.help_text: This will place and ID on the row that you'll be able to set an anchor tag and have the user jump down to this section of the page.

children.name: section_class
children.label: CSS Class:
children.help_text: This is helpful if you know just a enough of CSS to be dangerous.  Make sure that class names don't have spaces.

children.name: image_loading
children.label: Image Loading:
children.inline_help_text: Lazy image loading can improve performance if this module is lower on the page.
